title: On the multicomponent reactive flows in moving domains
authors:
Kuntal Bhandari, Stanislav Kra\v{c}mar, \v{S}\'arka Ne\v{c}asov\'a and
  Minsuk Yang
abstract:
This paper is concerned with the existence of global-in-time weak solutions
to the multicomponent reactive flows inside a moving domain whose shape in time
is prescribed. The flow is governed by the 3D compressible
Navier-Stokes-Fourier system coupled with the equations of species mass
fractions. The fluid velocity is supposed to fulfill the complete slip boundary
condition, whereas the heat flux and species diffusion fluxes satisfy the
conservative boundary conditions. The existence of weak solutions is obtained
by means of suitable approximation techniques. To this end, we need to
rigorously analyze the penalization of the boundary behavior, viscosity and the
pressure in the weak formulation.
